result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurtis S. Cline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kurtis S. Cline is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kurtis S. Cline was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:42 pm - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf57 (SEHR), 14cf106 (SEHR) and 15CF90 (AIA).  In 15cf90 - Richards in receipt of complaint, waive reading - will waive preliminary hearing.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State moves dismiss but read in counts 2 and 3.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Richards/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence 15CF90

from defendant requesting bond modification

11:04 am - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court with attorney Brian F Bennett.  Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in custody.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Kurt Kopacz/Sworn/Direct by Bednar - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Bennett/Court questions witness.  Bennett/Bednar statement to finding of probable cause.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  State files Information.  Bennett and defendant in receipt of Information, waives reading - not guilty pleas entered.  Bennett/Bednar statement to motion for modification of bond.  Bond currently set at $5,000.00 cash bond with condition may attend inpatient treatment if unable to post cash.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.
if unable to post cash bond - may attend inpatient treatment

03:56 pm - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court, via video,  with attorney Brian Bennett, defendant in custody.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bennett waives reading of complaint.  Bednar/Bennett to bond - currently has a $5,000 cash bond.  Court will not modify bond - except to attend inpatient treatment if accepted.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 11:00 am.

01:27 pm - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files report only.  Defendant in receipt of report.  Court finds probable cause does exist.  Michlig/Defendant to bond.  Court sets $5,000 cash bond.  Court recuses from this case.
